message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

This paper discusses manual evaluation methodology for summarization systems, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and human-computer interaction (HCI) techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related areas. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, which makes cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of crowdsourcing for evaluation suggests a focus on human-computer interaction, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) a possible sub-category. The paper proposes a lightweight sampling-based approach, which involves machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves statistical analysis and correlation, which suggests a focus on machine learning and data analysis, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
